decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then capitalize on them by triggering powerful effects such as Bridge from Below. By combining cards like Faithless Looting, Cabal Therapy, and Breakthrough, the deck aims to consistently dredge through the deck to assemble a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of creature tokens and explosive plays. The deck aims to be fast and relentless, aiming to win the game through sheer speed and overwhelming board presence.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while establishing a fast and aggressive board presence. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Rishadan Port to slow down the opponent's plays, while utilizing Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to efficiently bring out powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creature beats and disruptive elements. Additionally, cards like Flickerwisp and Palace Jailer provide additional control elements to keep the opponent on their toes.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns to maintain board presence and generate card advantage. The deck also includes efficient creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to help stabilize and pressure the opponent. The mana base is built around snow covered lands and Arcum's Astrolabe to enable consistent mana fixing and access to different colors.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo using cards like Crop Rotation, Vampire Hexmage, and Thespian's Stage. To protect the combo, the deck includes answers to disruption with cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Abrupt Decay. The deck also utilizes cards like Sylvan Library and Dark Confidant for card advantage and consistency. The inclusion of utility lands like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter allows for disruption of the opponent's game plan. Overall, the main focus of this deck is to efficiently assemble the Dark Depths combo while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Thespian's Stage. It also includes protection cards like Not of This World and disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Pithing Needle to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board and win the game quickly by creating a 20/20 Marit Lage token with Dark Depths and Vampire Hexmage. It has a toolbox of lands to search for with Crop Rotation and utility creatures like Elvish Reclaimer for added flexibility.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and applying pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures and efficient spellcasting. The combination of cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze, alongside powerful threats like Delver of Secrets and Oko, Thief of Crowns, allows for a fast-paced and proactive game plan. With disruption in the form of Force of Will and Spell Pierce, as well as card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board using disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Plague Engineer, while also maintaining tempo and card advantage through Aether Vial and cards like Baleful Strix and Recruiter of the Guard. Teferi, Time Raveler helps protect the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy, while the deck also includes some flicker effects with cards like Flickerwisp and Soulherder to generate additional value. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of disruptive creatures and card advantage engines.

This deck focuses on aggressive play using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Hooting Mandrills. It also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Stifle to control the game and protect your creatures. The deck utilizes card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure you have the right cards at the right time. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional disruption and can quickly take over the game. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent casting of spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between creatures and lands to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. The key strategy involves using cards like Green Sun's Zenith to search for powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Plague Engineer, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland. The deck also includes protection and graveyard hate in the form of Mother of Runes and Oath of Ghouls. By efficiently using its resources and maintaining board control, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on establishing a quick and aggressive board presence through efficient spells and creatures. By combining cheap removal like Lightning Bolt and efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building its own threats. The inclusion of versatile creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Dreadhorde Arcanist allows for consistent pressure on the opponent, while True-Name Nemesis provides a difficult-to-answer finisher. The land base is streamlined to support the quick and aggressive game plan of the deck.

The main focus of this Canadian Threshold aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently deploying threats and maintaining pressure. By using disruptive spells like Stifle and Daze, along with efficient removal and counter magic, the deck aims to control the board and protect its creatures. Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Hooting Mandrills provide a quick clock to apply pressure on the opponent, while cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns can help deal with problematic permanents. The deck's versatility and speed make it a formidable force in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with countermagic and mana denial. By using efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Dreadhorde Arcanist, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Wasteland and Daze helps to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns provide additional value and versatility to the deck's overall game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive threats like Death's Shadow and Delver of Secrets while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck aims to apply early pressure, control the board with disruptive spells like Daze and Fatal Push, and finish off the opponent efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of Oko, Thief of Crowns provides versatile removal and threat management. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and to support the deck's low curve.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, and then bring them back into play with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. This allows the player to cheat in big threats like Griselbrand, Iona, and Tidespout Tyrant ahead of schedule, overwhelming their opponent with powerful creatures earlier than expected. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Cabal Therapy and Unmask to control the opponent's hand and protect the combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to combo off by quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Chancellor of the Annex using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. The deck also includes fast mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual to help set up the combo quickly. There are also disruptive elements like Unmask and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The deck aims to win the game by generating a large storm count with Tendrils of Agony or by attacking with the reanimated creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo, combining Thespian's Stage with Dark Depths to create a 20/20 Merit Lage token in one turn. The deck is built around fast mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide, along with tutor cards like Crop Rotation and Once Upon a Time to find the combo pieces quickly. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the board and protect the combo. It aims to win the game as quickly as possible through this powerful combo interaction.
